intro: Ixia hexandra, commonly known as the golden torch lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are adapted for storage of nutrients, allowing it to survive dry periods. Ixia hexandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
